name: Gold Star Jerk and Seafood
address: 3768 White Plains Rd, Bronx, NY 10467, USA

reviews.text: Found hair in my food
Never disappoints. My go-to for over 20 years

I am so disappointed. Myself and eight other coworkers placed orders. These orders added up to over $200. My curry goat meal consisted of mostly bones with rice  and missing my plantains. My other  coworkers also missing sides from their meals. To top it off.. the delivery took over 2 hours and the drop off was 20 minutes away...NEEEVER AGAIN

These people don't even give sauce free, they don't give away prayerssss but will literally steal your change when you pay cash..  guy in there said he'd give me a shrimp to try & the old lady cashier charge me for it
They don‚Äôt miss
Don‚Äôt  spend no money in this established rude customer service horrible this lady in the front piss me off I ask a question respectfully and she was so rude plus the food garbage

Rude customer service, and they didn't leave any utensils or paper towels in the bag. AND TO TOO IT OFF, I Saw a ROACH IN MY SOUP üò°üò°üò°
This is a Nasty Place ü¶†ü§¢ EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK
Food is always good and fresh. Great music, but should lower a lil it so ordering can go smoother.

The food is not bad.. but the service is not good.. your met with mean looking faces and the one guy that wears a net over his head is rude and a liar.. 1st of of all he took my order and then skipped over my daughter and her father to serve someone that he knew and even the known customer said to him nah he's first. Where do they do that at.. next I asked for spicy shrimp which was spice but some shrimp were must and for some reason he stated to another customer that he's giving me extra and he didn't not sure why he stated that but he never gave me no damn extra.. the chicken soup can use more flavor and the oxtail tender but sweet not that sweet but they can hold off just a lil on the sweetness.. besides having peas in my cabbage which I don't like.. it's pretty much just steamed up with other veggies..  Will not be returning due to that rude staff tried to skip my man and daughter and not very welcoming.. the workers seems burnt out and not really happy.. wanted to add after that rude staff and I already ordered my daughter and my man did not place an order and I could've kept my $40

I‚Äôve been a customer for many years at this restaurant on any given day the food fluctuate my favorite food are lacking flavors, spice and the heart of what this restaurant was about. My last visit three weeks ago was very disappointing. Only thing I‚Äôll probably stop here for is the sorrel when I‚Äôm in the Bronx. I purchase the chicken foot (no spice was not season properly), fried chicken (lack its true flavor), stew peas (horrible) chicken soup (salt and not its usual taste). Seems changes in chef as it‚Äôs lost its original taste. I‚Äôm loyal to a fault and have been coming back hoping they‚Äôll get it but I‚Äôm tired as I did not eat some of the above it just sat in the refrigerator until it was time to throw out. I gave it a three because the staff and owner is nice.

I just want to add to my review I was desperate and went there against my judgement again. I got the curry chicken feet, jerk chicken pasta. The chicken feet nails was not removed I was so gross out I ended up throwing that food out I don‚Äôt think I can eat chicken feet for a while. My son did not eat the pasta I bought for him usually he would eat it but he let it stay in the refrigerator for a week before I threw it out. I dropped my ratings to two stars because for the most part Americans think this is a great food place but as a Jamaican I won‚Äôt ever visit this place for food again only for the drinks as my daughter like their passion fruit and I like the sorrel if the flavor does not change.
Delicious jamaican dishes in the Bronx, beware very pricey.
Fried shrimp, everything you need to know

I‚Äôm not from NY nor do I live here but whenever I do come here I can always count on good food, and one thing wid me as a Jamaican mi don‚Äôt buy Jamaican food, but di food right here so very nice, I enjoyed it, I got a medium plate and I shared that with fam and still had left overs I had way more meat than I thought I did and the chicken gravy did nice, I got dried chicken with rice & peas and steam veg!

Came all the way from Pennsylvania today . We have lots of Jamaican restaurants in Pennsylvania. Not one of them comes close to the great food I had here. Gold star food is 100% authentic Jamaican food. I had fried chicken rice and peas with raw vegetables, with a little stew chicken gravy. It reminded me of home in Mandeville Jamaica. Sooo flavorful! The restaurant decor was beautiful too, and all of the staff looked presentable and were very professional. I will definitely be taking the trip to New York just to have Goldstar again. Delicious! ‚ù§Ô∏èüíõüíö

I learned today they are just racist. I have been to this location twice and was ignored on line. Others have told me they were treated the same. The customers had to let the woman working know I was next and she rolled her eyes. The plate was very sloppy and only half filled both times.

On 7/25/2025 I went into the grocery store next door and as I ordered a sandwich in Spanish an older woman with the GoldStar uniform screamed out ‚Äúspeak English please‚Äù. The other female employee and a man that was with them laughed. I asked her in English who she was talking to and they hurried out of the store.

Food was great!
The steamed fish is excellent!

I ordered food and didn't know you had to pay extra for oxtail gravy. Mind you it was not even a whole spoonful. I asked the cashier why there was an extra charge! She said it's a 1$. It's the principle like tell the customer. The gravy even tasted burnt. So I threw it away. Off the rice. Not pleased.

Fried chicken with half rice & peas, half salad (cabbage with carrot) with curry goat gravy, also a large fruit punch juice. I ordered a side of macaroni salad and OMG it was absolutely amazing. I‚Äôll definitely be back next time in town üòãüòãüòãüî•üî•
Good place for Caribbean vibes and food
The BEST!! I've known the owner for Years from 169st. But he did his Big one when he opened Gold Star!! Open late and Open Early. Go treat yourself!! You will not regret it.

My daughter recommended this Restaurant! A young lady seemed stressed that I asked about the price. This was a surpriseüåö being there wasn‚Äôt any prices visible. She didn‚Äôt include the Plantains or gravy over my rice.‚Ä¶

People that lives out of town drives to your restaurant and get disappointed. Why when the food burns or catch the restaurant still put it out to sell like the customers money for quality food doesn‚Äôt count. Do better.
Great food she's location. Easy access of the train and service was fast and workers were nice .
Great jamaican food, I recommend the curry goat and stew peas.
So I've been to the location on 219th Street and White Plains Road.  The food is worth the price. The quantity that you get will fill you up and have you wanting  more. The staff is great!
Always good food and good service

Great jamaican food
Been a customer for years
The food is mostly good. But the last time I visited, everything was full of sugar. Had was to throw it out because I am very peculiar about what I put in my body.
Sorry I didn't take any pictures. The food here is delicious. Staff are hard working and patient. We have been here many times.
Food was good. Service was great.
Don't come here without an appetite. The portions are huge and the food is amazing. Been here 6 nights in a row!
üëç

I had a large order that included 2 orders of jerk chicken meals. They forgot to give me my 2 jerk chicken orders. I come back later and tell the same people what I was missing. They come back and give me just one order instead of two. This old lady told me ‚Äúyou only get one. Now go!‚Äù And before saying this she told me to give her my receipt. She ignored me and I went to a different worker who made sure I got my second jerk chicken. I should have checked my order the first time but still, this was very unprofessional. Never going back here again. This place needs to have younger people and not old people who are grumpy. Do better Gold Star.
The Jamaican porridge was amazing!
The best in the Bronx!
Awesome
Good food, bad attitude...Typical Jamaican restaurant!!! You can grab a drink at the bar as well. Cool little spot.
Food was delicious

Great food!  Amazing service! Fun neighborhood vibe!  Stopped by to try the food before ordering for a party.  Brown chicken (yum!), oxtails (so good!), jerk chicken (spicy but with a really good heat), ackee & salt fish, fried cauliflower, rice and beans, the most delicious cabbage accented with veggies.   The patties were perfect as appetizers paired with the fried cauliflower.  Will be back again for sure!!  Definitely try the drinks as well. Loved the soursop and the pineapple ginger; so fresh tasting!  Great experience overall!
They stewpeas was so nasty cold , food was all in the bag nothing to eat with. I just can‚Äôt believe it was this bad. And they didn‚Äôt want to give me my money back .
Don‚Äôt believe the hype this place is nasty with nasty attitudes

Before I speak on the food, THE VIBE WAS EVERYTHING. The DJ was serving great tracks and really getting us in the mood for some dancing. Now, there wasn't any dancing happening but it's not because the music wasn't fire! DJ Dougie really did his thing here.

Now the food, the selection seemed endless!! We ended up getting white rice, rice and peas, curry goat, oxtails, sweet and sour chicken, cabbage, mac and cheese, plantains, and one of each drink they serve. Everything. Was. Delicious. The serving sizes were generous. It fed us yesterday and today! The goat and oxtails were tender and so flavorful. The lemonade and the fruit punch had a twist, with some ginger. But the pink drink was sweet and tangy. 10/10 would recommend. The seating options are limited, but If you are able to snag on and enjoy the music with the food, it's all worth it!!
Curry goat roti was horrible. Way too oily and nasty. Highly do not recommend. The restaurant was very clean though, loved the music and the workers were nice.
Prices are not listed so they tell you one price and try to charge you another. There are 10 other Caribbean restaurants in the area. Let your money go further elsewhere.

I usually get the fried large crabs a generous amount of the crabs usually given , on this particular day it appeared to be a server I‚Äôve never seen before.  When she said ‚Äúnext‚Äù I indicated large crabs please , as she packed the plastic bowl with   The eight crabs I stated I ordered a large , I would usually get me she uttered well dats it.  I shook my head and ask for fried shrimp she look at me very angry and said people these days, I couldn‚Äôt understand where the frustration came from .  I said wow smh , then i politely asked how much was the fried chicken she ignored me and the said you want it
Great food always, lots of options to choose from, clean, pleasant.
These people are rude to delivery people nasty attitude talking Jamaica language like it‚Äôs America speak English so people could understand
Fast service, great tasting food...love the variety
Delicious oxtails and the very best Red Snapper and Seafood rice that I‚Äôve ever tasted in my life. Now I want to eat here every week.

I will not be going back to the store. This store was very disrespectful. I came in as a DoorDasher  to get an order and they judged me off of appearance they were very disrespectful. Did not want to serve me the other young lady who was serving food to the other customers had to stop to come and give me the order while they all stood in the back laughing I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone they have poor customer service.

Gold Star truly offers the best Jamaican food in New York! Every dish I tried was bursting with authentic flavors that took me right back to the island. The jerk chicken was seasoned to perfection, with the right blend of spice and smokiness that defines a true Jamaican jerk. The curry chicken was tender and full of rich, complex flavors, and the stews were hearty and comforting. You can taste the love and tradition in every bite, and it‚Äôs clear that quality ingredients and skilled preparation are at the heart of everything they serve.

If you're looking for genuine Jamaican cuisine, Gold Star is the spot. Highly recommend trying everything on the menu; you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

First time there last week and I spent almost $80 worth of food with my family and I ! Honestly, everything was flavorful.. but the rice was a little grainy(should‚Äôve cooked a little longer) perhaps it was rushed?

Asked a friend for the best Jamaican food in the Bronx I was told Gold Star.  Im glad I tried gold star . ..good service,  fair prices, located right at a subway station  so I hopped off the subway the restaurant is right at the Se entrance/exit of 219ST station...most of all was the taste  was absolutely delicious....10/10 experience for me.

I live a block away from Gold Star, and I have to say: the food is really good. Everything I‚Äôve ordered from here is good.
If you go to the store, note that they have food in the back that you can‚Äôt see upfront (like Mac and cheese).
I have had some trouble ordering from here, but nothing too bad. Any time I order via Uber Eats, they don‚Äôt begin preparing the food until I go to the store.
With that said, if you live in the area, you know the level of service to expect. And the food is worth it.

Said they don‚Äôt have a small only medium and large  oxtails. But gave me a tub full of rice and 6 oxtails. For 20$ I think you should definitely give more oxtail. This isn‚Äôt the first time they mess up my proportion of food but when someone else orders , the food portion is way better. SMH

I love Jamaican food, but this is the worst one I have eaten so far, I love jerk chicken with rice and peas. how can they  mess up this chicken was extremely  salty. The red snapper meal I bought was okay not great. My worst  jerk chicken please don‚Äôt waste your money.

OMG!!! Where to begin????
I honestly don't know where to begin.
From the point of entering the restaurant and speaking with each and everyone, the service was beyond exceptional.

Dawn our server and cashier, girl big up uself!!
To all the chefs and other staff, tombs up.

Now the fooooood!!!! My family had a hard time chosing simply because everything, and I do mean everything was delicious. Well seasoned and prepared.

I will never forget this taste for sure.
Thank you all for the warm ambiance, service and tasty dishes.

My prayer is that God continue to bless your business as you continue to serve.

A couple of years ago, I would visit here to get my oxtail fix, back then it was about 12 dollars or so for medium, but the portion was good and consistent. I went there yesterday paid  almost 15 dollars for a medium oxtail and I was given‚Ä¶

What happened to the food here?! I used to love their curry chicken, the last couple of times it's just off. I was trying not to give up and figured the time before was just a bad batch. This time around the rice was very hard and the curry‚Ä¶
Poor customer service and the food is not even worth mentioning. There is nothing I hate more than spending money on bad food. Plus they forgot part of my order.

I was worried about coming here because of the reviews but let me tell you the customer service was fine. They weren't tripping over themselves to serve us or address us but we weren't ignored. They were pleasant enough. The food was PRICEY  2 LARGE OXTAIL, A bottle of (excellent) sorrel and a carrot punch was ran me over $60. The food was also good enough. My father and I will continue the hunt but this spot was solid.

I ate here a couple time, the food was always good they also had a wide variety of food that‚Äôs big plus‚Ä¶ im talking about food that JA restaurants wouldn‚Äôt normally sell. The best cornmeal porridge I‚Äôve had in a LONG time I bought some for my coworker and he loved it, I‚Äôm taking that 30 mins drive before work go get some more in the morning. I gave it a 4 star because it‚Äôs a bit pricey, but food is definitely a 10/10.

Thisvwas my first time eating at this restaurant. The Salmon and the cauliflower rice with vegetables. Absolutely blew me away the taste seasoning spot on the rice spot on vegetables nice soft with a crisp this is my new favorite place telling you five stars all the way

I went into gold star on a Saturday that's the day they serve goat soup.I've noticed they're substituting their ground provision for what's cheap in the stores. For instance...Their using "HUGE" chunks of carrots and "LOTS" of chocho‚Ä¶
I ordered with Uber eats, I specifically asked nicely for gravy on the rice & jerk sauce on the chicken wings. I get sever a DRY plate of rice & chicken . By the way this is a large ü§£‚Ä¶

Really really really good food.  Great selection.  I couldn't decide what to eat out of all that beautiful food so I got a scoop of about 5 different things and can't wait to go back to try the rest.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND

The food was absolutely delicious!
Heavy portions for a great price.
I loved how they were blasting r&b music.
Service could improve as there was a long wait to be served while there were plenty of staff behind the counter. Perhaps having a system in place would help keep customers moving quickly. Overall I loved the food! 10/10

Made an order and they didn‚Äôt have what i wanted. Instead of offering other options it sounded like they didn‚Äôt care to help the person picking up the food. Then when they knew cancelling my order had to be done on their end they said we had to do it. I had to call them to tell them there was no way for me to do that and attitude is what i got immediately and its not even cancelled. Not even a sorry. And it wasn‚Äôt even closing time yet for them to have nothing left. Mark it out or stop accepting delivery maybe?!?!
